    Remote Roast

    Rating Twin Cities coffee shops for remote work.

    Share

    Juliet + Osmar
    After four years as a barista at a Minnesota coffee chain that shall not be named, Juliet is now a Data Analyst at the Star Tribune. After dropping out of bartending school, Osmar is now a computational neuroscience researcher at the University of Minnesota. They both like americanos, but Osmar prefers iced and Juliet likes it hot ;)

    Summer Round Up

    It's cold. We're sad. Let's reflect on Summer.

    Did you think we'd be consistent in posting every week? That's on us for lying but also on you for believing us.

    via GIPHY

    The Shots

    Coffee Shop City # Stars Wifi speed Suitable for meetings? $ Small Drip Coffee
    Wesley Andrews Minneapolis
    		21 Maybe $4
    Roots Roasting St Paul
    		120 Maybe $2.75
    Up Cafe & Up Coffee Roasters Minneapolis
    		360 Yes $2.30


    Spilling the Beans

    Up Cafe & Up Coffee Roasters

    Up Cafe was the next stop on our coffee journey this summer and we loved it!

    • Up Cafe has a ton of seating - especially with their outdoor tables in the summer. You'll never be hunting for a spot.
    • The wifi works pretty well outside. Maybe not for a meeting, but for other work, you have something to look forward to when it's warm again.
    • They lose some points for not having quite enough outlets.
    • Lots of options for non-coffee drinkers including energy drinks for those who still want a little boost.

    Roots Roasting

    Next, we took a trip to our college neighborhood for some classic expresso drinks at Roots Roasting.

    • While small, roots usually has an open seat.
    • Roots has a comfortably minimalist environment making it great for concentration.
    • There are enough outlets for one per table, but probably not one per person.
    • Roots has great pastries from Marc Heu, but no meal options.

    Wesley Andrews

    Wesley Andrews was on our final stop this summer. Highly requested after visiting with a friend, we made sure to do a review.

    • Wesley Andrews is weird but in a great way. With seasonal drinks like the Cuban Coffee Soda, you're sure to find something you've never tried before.
    • Prices are a little steep here. Not without good reason, the coffee is great and a lot of thought is put into it. But if you're looking to save some money, you probably won't make this a regular spot.
    • The wifi can be slow. It's enough to do basic work and low stakes meetings, but I wouldn't count on it for the big things.
    • No lunch items here, but there are gluten free pastries. Tried and loved by a gluten free friend.


    That's what we've got, folks! Stick around for more round ups, and keep an eye on our Instagram for new reviews as we release them!
